p: The results corroborate with Siripornvisal et al. [ 67] who found the in vitro MIC of LO as 15 µL/mL when tested against B. cinerea. However, for Penicillium spp., the results were not in accordance with Li et al. [ 70], who observed the MIC of LO as 20 µL/mL, which was lower than 30 µL/mL found in this study. Several factors contribute to the difference in MIC values, which include the major components of EOs, extraction method and difference in fungi strain being tested [ 25].
